content.description: Start laying down to the right of Spidey Direct and Spidey Crack...you will see a spot right next to a tree.  Work left, this time, staying low and finish on the crimpers on Spidey Direct.
Start out SDS far left.  Work right using flakes and crimpers.  Top out on left side.  Be careful many flakes have been broken off this boulder.
This is the route on Spiderman where you SDS and work up and left.  Topping out on the left taller part of the boulder.
SDS work up and right through the crack.  Tops out on right side of boulder.
Hug the featured arete down low, heel hook, and make a huge throw around the back.
content.location: Route is located on the right side of Spiderman boulder, if you are in front of the sign.

content.description: Crux off the ground. Low foot options, with a high left foot below mantle.
content.location: Mantle on the back side of Spiderman main boulder.

content.description: Start out in the thin seam and work up to the crack overhead.  Crux is getting established down low.
content.location: Backside of Spiderman boulder.  Side that faces Yellow Arete.

content.description: Crimp/Sidepull low to a slopey topout.  Another good Boat Rock mantle.
content.location: Looking directly at Spiderman boulder you will notice a 10-15ft long boulder off to the right side.  Walk around and you will find this problem on the front.

climbs.name: Doc Ock Traverse
climbs.fa: Everett S (Likely done before and not recorded)

content.description:
Start the same as Antivenom. Continue until where you would normally top out. Instead of slapping high around the arete, reach low and heel hook to the rail that you would normally step on. Its the same one that begins The Other Side (the problem). Control the swing and keep traversing low, without getting on or above the rail, until you reach Chalk Me Up Spidey, complete it and top out.

 Note: It's possible I didn't get the first ascent, but I can't find any mention of this anywhere, and I like the name. So, I'm putting it out there for others.
content.protection: Many pads, or someone moving pads.

content.description: Start standing at the vertical rail on the west side and top out via offset holds.
content.location: This problem is located on the boulder between Dishes and Spiderman.

content.description: Start left hand on a sloper crimp, right hand on a sightly lower side pull, and a very high foot. Stand up then work right toward the curved crack. Follow the crack up to top out. (If anyone has suggestions for a more accurate grade or changes to the problem, drop a comment and I'll adjust the description. Thanks!)
content.protection: Very safe landing. Watch out for the tree. 2 pads is enough but you can get by with one pad and a spotter.
content.location: Back side of the Spider-man Rock. If you're looking at the rock, the problem starts just to the left of this thin, short tree.

content.description: Easy little slab.  There are some crimps at top for mantling and good feet all around.
content.location: This boulder is located on the left before you get to the spiderman boulder.  The front doesn't look that climbable but there is a jump start problem.  The back has a few easy routes, this being one of them.

content.description: Start same as Spiderman Traverse, but instead of working up right to top out, continue right and low 3/4 away around the boulder and finish in a crack (The Other Side, V1).
Hit "Improve This Page" to submit a description!
